reviews.review_msg: I absolutely loved this course! Martin Laba is a phenomenal prof. So engaging, interesting, and inspirational. I suggest everyone to take this course, even if you are not a cmns student. The grading is also very fair.

the class was ok, but didn't offer anything really new in the frame of media and society, department are somewhat repetitive. martin is all personality, less substance, a bit out of touch. nearing the end of his teaching career but acts more like a 20something with his hipster clothes and talk, plus loves attention. office hours good

Interesting and engaging topics. Very informed with current events and pop. culture. Keeping up with pop. culture and also rewarding because it has educational value (best of both worlds?) Prof is passionate about teaching and the subjects.

Essay is worth 40% of total mark, so I recommend taking if you have strong writing skills. Both the midterm and final are based ONLY on the readings, but to get a perfect mark you have to use examples used in lectures (final is take-home). Martin is a great prof, and he used great (and relevant) case studies weekly. One of my fave courses.

Martin is an amazing professor. The course material was alive and relevant. the class felt more like an interesting conversation than a long lecture. Exams are easy if you show up to class and have a basic understanding of the readings, same applies to the final paper. Honestly a great course and a great prof.

Martin is a prof who truly cares about his students succeeding, and really sees school through our eyes.  He makes this class enjoyable and easy to do well in if you show up to lecture, tutorial, and do the term paper and exams (very simple).  I really enjoyed this class with him and would take it again.

Martin's lectures are a little all over the place, and they make you look at tbus to wonder if you fell into a time warp or something. Despite that, Martin is incredibly passionate about what he teaches and is such a nice guy to be around. An all around all star!
Martin was the best prof I've had. He is so passionate about his classes. I would LOVE to take another class with him.

He has a lot of passion for the material, the students and the actual work in the community. Take at least one of his courses (he teaches 2 plus a multi-prof publishing course), you will not be disappointed. He is up-to-date and relevant with his material and readings, something lacking from other CMNS courses. Talk to him during office hours too.

I looked forward to every lecture. Martin is very passionate about his job and encourages students to fully engage-to actively observe the world around you and participate with purpose. He is incredibly helpful and an all around great man. Left the course feeling like I could do  something purposeful with my life. Take the time to talk to him.

Great speaker and a nice guy. He comes across as being the most egoistic man you'll encounter.It's not an easy course, but as long as you do all the readings and attend tutorials (TA-ADINA EDWARDS is awesome) you'll do fine.Regarding his MT, he claims you don't need to study but seriously, do the readings.

He really is a great prof. Extremely passionate about his job and makes lectures worth attending. Got to know the prof on a more personal level, very down to earth. If you have the chance just go and strike up a conversation. No textbook required which is great, and exams are relatively easy as long as you keep up with the readings.
awesome teacher! super interested in the world which is refreshing. tries to engage students in the lectures. highly recommend his class!!!!

Great guy. Get to know him for real, and he's a pretty chill and open guy. Not as snobbish as I would imagine a director of communications should be. Readings are alright, lectures can be a bit boring at times. But overall, it's a pretty good course. And definitely taking his classes again. He got nice clothes too. Haha.

Awesome Prof! Confident, smart and funny. His lectures can be a bit boring because he tells long stories. He has a big vocabulary which is sometimes difficult to understand when you are half asleep. Very passionate about cmns. Always offers his help to students. Very open-minded but does not like ppl sleeping in class. Definitely take his class aga
He's an okay prof. He tries really hard which is cute. Get's offended if you peace or sleep. He does make the class seem more than it actually is and it's really just an okay class.

He inspires you to not just get a degree to further enhance your chances of getting a job, but to hopefully use it as a means in changing the world. Almost every class I leave thinking that Communications is an amazing major, especially after his class on media advocacy. I can't wait to take another class with him!

Even though the work was easy enough, lectures would switch from interesting to unbearable.  I have to say, he is very over-the-top, speaking loudly one minute, holds for dramatic pause, then whispers a concluding line.  He also loves wasting time trying to establish himself as one of those hip-and-inspiring-profs instead of covering course content

A class with Dr. Laba should not be missed. I personally felt the path he guided the course to be one that was inspiring. At Simon Fraser University it can be easy to get caught-up with the "business" of getting a degree and forget to enjoy the process itself. For me, Dr. Laba welcomed this back into my education and made me consider more.

Total waste of time/money.  All ?lectures? relate back to the only socio/cultural topic of importance, himself.  Suffers from massive ego deficit which means grand storytelling with no academic publications, papers, presentations, anything, to back it up.  Let others who are capable teach.  A missed career in fertilizer management.

Best Prof... He was one of the reason why I decided that Communications is my life and an awesome faculty... well not that he's the reason, but his classes are so interesting and all the students loves him, he's got that confidence that assure the students that they can actually have an impact in our society. He is also friendly and wonderful.

Greatest Prof so far and I am in third year. Martin's class blows you away with stories that you never even thought of. He makes you aware and feel intelligent and like you have learned something very important at the end of the day. Very enthusiastic and into Communications, he believes that if we all work together we can help some good changes.

Martin is a great prof! He tries to give you informative yet interesting 2-hour lectures - a totally different experience compared to the CMNS courses I have taken so far. This class is neither easy nor difficult, as long as you try your best, you can get a decent mark. Very useful and interesting materials learned!

He's an awesome instructor. As long as you do your readings, you will find that all his anecdotes relate to the course material. He's very helpful and fair. He keeps his promise. He's absolutely committed to teaching and is passionate about social issues and his students.

Looks like Tom Ford; has personality of Tom Cruise. Lectures are grand narratives staunch supporter of social engagement/causes. Energetic & humorous lectures, but too many anecdotes & digressions in almost all lectures makes things a bit confusing. Fairly approachable prof. Fair marker. tip: Start writing your term paper early.

The class material is pretty interestin but by the end of the term,u'll realize that almost every single lecture sounds the same.Prof talks alot but 90% of the stuff he says does not relate to course materials but about HIMSELF.Seriously,he is too into himself!!

he is my prof for cmns 221 at harbour center; he is a great lecturer. eventhough his ideas and insight is compelling and thought-provoking, he goes off topi and has trouble in relating his dialogue with the course content. his course media and audiences is a milieu of contemporary trends going on in the world like paradoxe
No Comments

I did like him at first because he's funny and has a sense of fashion style. Then I found him arrogant and i believe he's a bit in love with himself. He is a good speaker but yeah hez very ego-centric. Fun to listen to sometimes but I don't think I will take another class with him agin.

Brilliant lecturer and very knowledgeable but also arrogant, self-absorbed, and really uninterested in his students. I think he really just likes to listen to himself talk. And yeah he comes in to do his lectures on consumerism in at least $1000 of couture.

Great prof.  In the famous words of Green Day though, he is a "walking contradiction": wears Armani shirts, lives in Yaletown, and yet complains about consumerist behaviour.  He might just be the epitome of "postmodernism".
Captivating lecturer, fascinating to listen to...sort of a superstar prof. Not perfect in terms of making time for people, but I'd take another class with him any day.
very nice teacher. his lectures are very interesting and captivating. a very causal setting, both tutorial and lecture.

Very engaging and dynamic speaker. He lectures to a whole room full of students yet it feels like he's speaking directly to you. His discussions are amazing and he shows a genuine interest in students' concerns. He could make any class interesting.
Martin Laba is interesting, provocative and outright HOT.  *Has joygasm*.
No Comments
whoever said, "pretentious" is right on target. masturbating his own ego takes up most of his lectures and i really don't know what i was supposed to learn from that class.

Oh, he is WONDERFUL... one of the best and the way he lectures is great.  His stuff just floats and makes us articulate our points instead of plain remembering terms and cases.... a wonderful prof - all CMNS majors MUST take a class with our Director!

good style, good speaking skills.  makes interesting and comedic references that lighten things up a bit.. pretty easy to listen to most of the time, in comparison to other profs i've had.. he's a friendly, nice guy.

Interesting lectures. Good course. Fair in marking, not too hard on you. Can seem insincere at times, but really means what he says. Just remember that he's the director, unless you want to be reminded EVERY TIME you talk to him!

Goes way off topic, as interesting as his lectures are, but are not relevant at all. Very nice (maybe a bit high on himself) but will do anything for his students. Very fair assignments, but his lectures are pointless.
No Comments
Pretentious and full of BS.  if he'd stay on topic for once, maybe that would even things out.
No Comments
No Comments
entertaining lecturer but his own opinions are gospel.  Also very arrogant
Awesome lecturer and entertaining!! (get's off topic sometimes though)
great speaker, funny and interesting
Gave really good lectures, found the assignments straightforward and she was well organized.
I enjoyed taking his classes, and reading the material.
Very, very nice prof. He is very helpful, and he never gets angry!

He's a really relaxed and cheery person, always finding things fascinating or amazing. The course was not overly challenging. Lecture notes are not available online, so go to class! He likes to play a lot of videos and reference things to the Simpsons.

Anil or "Neil" warms my heart. He is so amazing as a teacher and an even better person. I was going to drop the class before meeting him because it was far from home, but upon meeting him, i had to stay and I am glad I did!

are you guys kidding? this is not what i went to university for. to listen to a prof explain to me why everyone LOVES ipods and how cool they are, and to show me YT clips.  he may've made everyone laugh with his "approachable, youthful" manner but 2 me, he just had nothing interesting to say. I can watch YT on my own time. this is why cmns's a joke
he's so hot. just take the class. he's really nice, the class isn't too hard, you'll do great if you attend class and do the readings. he's just so hot. that's all.

a genuinely nice guy, midterm and assignments are not hard. He is very easy going and usually makes the class laugh with all his non-sense comments, we love it though. Very interactive with the class during lecture. Midterm was 2 short essays on a choice of 5 questions based on five articles from our courseware. Easy to tell which will be tested.

Anil is a nice guy, very easy going and an interesting character. He makes sarcastic jokes a lot, some are funny. He tries to show lots of videos in class, not too much reading and the midterm was extremely fair. Not a hard class

Shan was a genuinely lovely person and seemed to be looking out for the best interests of her students. Make sure you attend lectures because she does not post slides online, and exams are based off them entirely. Fairly easy and interesting class if you don't skip!

Shan was a great prof. Lectures were 2 hours but felt way shorter because she mixed up the lectures with power points and youtube videos. Her lectures were so easy to follow that studying for the mid-term wasn't really mandatory if you were showing up to class. There course consisted of a 5 min presentation, mid-term, term paper and take home exam.

Stuart is a very fun guy. His classes have a great vibe and you can tell he loves talking to his students. He sparks meaningful discussions in live classes, however my only gripe is that his prerecorded asynchronous lectures are very dull. They are boring and it often feels like he talks about literally nothing for 1 hour.

Dr. Poyntz (Stuart) has by far been one of the best professors I have had the joy to take a class with. His style is highly engaging; both the lectures and readings are easy to follow and can easily be compared to real-life scenarios. A majority of this class is showcasing learning through discussion posts. I thoroughly enjoyed CMNS 221.

Poyntz is probably the most prepared lecturer I've ever witnessed. He is passionate about what he teaches and he instantly captivates people. He even went to great lengths to bring in Shad, a popular hip-hop artist to come do a guest lecture. I can't wait to take more courses with him!

Believe the hype — this guy is one of the most engaging and well-prepared lecturers I've ever had. It's obvious he's genuinely passionate about the subject matter, and he manages to make even the driest topics interesting without going off on crazy tangents like other profs often do. If you get the chance, take a class with this guy.
Stuart is a really nice and helpful professor. His lectures were so interesting and he has lots of passion on every single lecture. I really like him!!! I would love to take his other courses!!

I new I;d love stuart within the first ten mintutes of the first class. He is really clear and passionate. I learned a lot and I was only paying attention half the time. He's entertaining to listen to and he will ALWAYS reference at least one movie a lecture. great man.
Stuart is such an interesting and engaging professor. Make sure you go to all the lectures and you will do well on the midterm and final. One of my favorite profs at SFU so far!!

Stuart is an awesome prof. He is really passionate about what he talks about and he uses great contemporary examples. He really cares about his students doing well and encourages questions. Great prof, highly recommended. Only thing, lots of info at each lecture so make sure you attend class. Also, LOTS of readings
Very engaging lecturer! You will do well on the midterm and final if you pay attention in lecture and tutorial.
Very engaging lecturer, and the subject was very interesting. Assignments are fair and if you pay attention to lecture you will do well.

Stuart is INCREDIBLE. Favourite prof at SFU so far. He does absolutely everything he can to get his students interested in the course, and the class is usually completely full. Graham was also an amazing T.A. I look forward to taking more classes with Stuart (and Graham) in the future.
Best prof I had in SFU. Great Lecturer. hope to take him again.

Really great prof! Very enthusiastic about his work and engaging lectures.  There might only be a problem if the material doesnt interest you, but the information is definitely all relevant, depending on if you care or not. Exams are depend pretty heavily on the readings so you probably want to at least skim over and recognize the key concepts.

Stuart is by far the best prof i've ever had! highly recommended. he's very interesting and super easy to understand, and the course material was great. he shows a lot of youtube videos, which is pretty cool too.

Omg, best prof ever! So cool, nice, SUCH a good dresser. I could listen to him talk forever, and theres something about him that makes him hot. I loved actally going to class just to listen to him, its a great course too, very interesting and gives you room to explore CMNS topics. Boring crap TA's though, but wow stuart was great!
LOVED HIM!!! he is a very good prof and is willing to help. Extremely empathetic to students. This is a great course to take with him, you can tell he has the passion to teach.

I took CMNS 110 and 221 with Stuart and he's by far one of my favorite profs at sfu, very clear and engaging, does everything in his power to keep his examples current and up to date. MT and final, no surprises, if you pay attention you will definitely be able to pass. Term papers gives you a lot of freedom for exploration. Good feedback also.
Passionate about topic and well-informed.  One of the most interesting 200 level cmns courses.
Clear communicator, repeats to get the main points across well, killer midterm
The Best.
No Comments

Roman is a really funny and brilliant prof. Lectures are always entertaining, but he's not very organized with notes. He's easy going and understands the students. Notes are put up on the web to make it easy to study for exams. Take cmns with Roman if you want a good laugh.

Hmmmm... Roman, Roman, Roman.  You love him or you hate him.  Personally, I think he's amazing to talk to.  He definitely has interesting stories, and he genuinely cares about his students.  However, he's NOT a good lecturer, and is hardly ever available as he has too many outside commitments.
His lectures are such a waste of my time. I don't think that hearing about his adventures with flaming bags of poo is very relevant to course material.

he is an instructor with so much knowledge. he taught me how to deal with my first semester at sfu. he is an inpiring and insightful instructor. he is always ready to listen. i wish i could take all the courses he teaches.
Pretty good
Hilarious! Really makes the lecturs enjoyable, and knows his stuff! Very easygoing and takes into consideration students feedback. Efficient emailer too!
One of the best profs at SFU. Great!

Simply amazing prof and human being. Makes you want to look forward to lecture each week. He's funny, personable, intelligent, educated and confident enough in himself to make his students feel the same way.
Hottest professor of SFU by far.

Dr Pedri is caring but her assignments are so vague which leave no guidance what so ever. Ta was tough marker and lectures don't have much to do with assignments but attendance is mandatory so… you should go.

Very enthusiastic and sweet to students. She makes sure the assignments are engaging and interesting, although they do take pretty long. I've never listened to a lecture or done a reading in any class ive taken with her and always get a good grade. You can tell she loves what she does, your grade is just dependent on the TA.

ive taken both 120 and 221. from what i recall the lectures are completely useless for what is actually graded in this course. TAs graded strict making it very hard to excel in this class. the class might as well be curved because to get an A you have to be better than everyone else.

I loved this course & the lectures! Topics in lecture are super interesting & she's a very passionate lecturer which makes it even better. The assignments were pretty easy but our TA sucked, so I had to go to her for every question I had, but she explains things well and is super easy to talk to. Highly recommend

so bad. doesn't give clear instructions for assignments and leaves u to fend for yourself. talks a whole lotta nothing in lectures. says we're allowed two sick days but doesn't give u full marks for lecture attendance when you use them. everyone loves her and idk why - had her for 120 and it was the same. her TAs suck & grade like they're MIT profs

Absolutely horrible. He didn't plan any of the course or assignments so was just making everything up as he went along. Result was everything: 2 exams and a final paper being crammed into the last day of class. He also cancelled about half the classes the day of with no explanation. Totally disorganized and incompetent and not fit to be a prof!

Really enjoyed taking a class with Dr. Malcic. He creates a positive environment with engaging lectures. Would recommend taking a class with him at SFU. The overall content was interesting and the lectures were engaging.

Michael Markwick is an amazing professor! Passionate, engaged, witty and full of life. Talks to his students instead of at them and really tries to create an inclusive community within the classroom. He will change the way you see education! Brilliant.

The best prof I'd had by far! I didn't even have to TRY to pay attention... he's very clear on the concepts, and keeps things interesting by drawing lots of examples from pop culture. He even photocopied the CCW for us for $20, saving us students a lot of money!
One of my fav CMNS profs
